src.edinpy.fermion package

Submodules

src.edinpy.fermion.fermion module

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.DoF(N_eigenvalues, name=None)[source]

Bases: object

Create a degree of freedom.

Parameters:

  • N_eigenvalues (int) – Number of eigenvalues of the associated observable, e.g. electron spin has 2 eigenvalues, a chain of 5 atoms has 5 position eigenvalues.

  • name (string) – Name of the observable.

property N

Number of eigenvalues set by parameter N_eigenvalues. :type: int

property label

Numerical label given to the degree of freedom :type: int

property name

Name given to the degree of freedom :type: string

src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.clear()[source]

Clear the degrees of freedom and fock space stored as global variables. It is necessary to call this function when you want to change the model.

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.dagger(indices, site)[source]

Bases: operator

Hermitian adjoint of an operator.

Parameters:

  • indices (iterable or int) – The indices which the operator acts on. If indices is an int then it is assumed to refer to the effective site.

  • site (int) – Effective site that the operator acts on.

property dag

Return the Hermitian adjoint of the operator.

property string

Return the string representing the operator.

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.fermionspace[source]

Bases: object

Create a fermionic Fock space.

build()[source]

Build the fock space basis vectors.

contains(s)
firstvector()[source]

Generate the first fermionic occupation vector in lexicographical order, i.e. the state with lowest integer representation.

nextvector(fv)[source]

Calculate the next occupation vector in lexicographical order.

Source: https://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html#NextBitPermutation

Parameters:

fv (fockstate) – a fermionic occupation vector

show()[source]

Print all the basis states.

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.fockstate(state, amp=1, index=None)[source]

Bases: object

Create a fermionic Fock state.

Parameters:

  • state (int) – Occupation numbers of the effective sites represented as an integer.

  • amp (scalar) – Probability amplitude of the state. Default value is 1.

  • index (int) – Index of the state. Used when constructing a Fock space. Default is None.

is_occupied(_calc_effsite)[source]

Determine whether the effective site is occupied. :param _calc_effsite: effective site index :type _calc_effsite: int :rtype: bool

property string

Human readable representation of Fock state. :rtype: str

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.hamiltonian(obj)[source]

Bases: object

Create a hamiltonian.

Parameters:

obj (operator, operatorsum, operatorproduct or hamiltonian) – Operator form of the hamiltonian

property array

Return the dense matrix form of the Hamiltonian. Calculates the matrix if it hasn’t been already. :rtype: np.array

calc_matrix()[source]

Calculate the matrix form of the Hamiltonian.

eigsolve(sparse=True, numeigs=2, which='SA')[source]

Calculate the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • sparse (bool) – Determine whether to calculate the eigensystem using sparse or dense linear algebra.

  • numeigs (int) – Number of eigenvalues and eigenvectors to return. Set to ‘all’ to return all eigenvalues.

  • which (str) – Determine the order in which to calculate the eigenvalues. See scipy.sparse.linalg.eigsh.

property eigvals

Return the calculated eigvals of the Hamiltonian.

property eigvecs

Return the calculated eigvecs of the Hamiltonian.

property sparse

Return the sparse matrix form of the Hamiltonian. Calculates the matrix if it hasn’t been already. :rtype: scipy.sparse.csr_matrix

class src.edinpy.fermion.fermion.model(Nf, auto=True)[source]

Bases: object

Construct a model with the stored degrees of freedom.

Parameters:

  • Nf (int) – Number of fermions.

  • auto (bool) – If auto is True then the Fock space is calculated automatically, otherwise the user must use the build() method to calculate it manually.

property Nbasis

Number of basis states in the Fock space. :type: int

property Neff

Number of effective sites. :type: int

activate()[source]

Set this model as the active instance.

build()[source]

Build the Fock space with the given number of fermions and degrees of freedom.

property dofs

List of instances of degrees of freedom. :type: list

property fockspace

Class instance for the relevant Fock space of the current model. :type: fermionspace
